column4: i'm running hoary have included universe and multiverse in my sources. for several days (or weeks?) now package acroread does not update.
i get dependancy errors: acroread: Depends: libc6 (>= 2.3.4-1) but 2.3.2.ds1-20ubuntu13 is to be installed
Depends: libgcc1 (>= 1:4.0.0-7) but 1:4.0-0pre6ubuntu7 is to be installed
np, I'm used to debian, just tell me on what base universe and multiverse is built. ubuntu unstable?
but universe/multiverse packages are obviously not built on top of hoary (different glibc-version). so what do they use?
or at least this applies to the acroread package
So why is there a dependency problem? how can acroread from multiverse depend on libc6 (>= 2.3.4-1)?
that is not acroread in multiverse
that will be the breezy package you look at...
ah ok, thanks for the clarification
how stable is breezy already? is a switch advisable for a desktop system?
